name: The British Isles cruise

activePartner.label: Voyages to Antiquity
activePartner.partnerDescription: Voyages to Antiquity combine the comfort and benefits of small-ship cruising with the thrill of discovering historic sites, new cultures and stunning natural landscapes. Their philosophy is to introduce travellers to the ancient world on a ship that can reach destinations inaccessible to larger vessels. Telegraph readers will delight in the guided shore excursions, programme of lectures from informative guest speakers during each cruise. Clients can now enjoy new destinations and themed cruises across the Caribbean, Cuba, Mediterranean and Northern Europe, and Voyages to Antiquity also cater for solo travellers with low supplements and sumptuous single cabins. Your holiday is provided by Voyages to Antiquity, ABTA (Y2206), ATOL (10093), a company wholly independent of Telegraph Media Group Limited.

overview:
This fabulous no-fly cruise sets sail beneath the gaze of London's Tower Bridge, on a circumnavigation of the sceptred isle beginning with the cobblestone streets of St Peter Port in the Channel Islands.

See the world's largest global garden, the Eden Project in Cornwall. Explore the Abbey Gardens of Tresco and step ashore on the Isle of Angelsey in Wales. Then cross the Irish Sea to Dublin, one of Europe's finest cities.

Scotland is a place of many iconic sights, including Inveraray Castle, the Old Man of Storr, and the late Queen Mothers favourite Highland residence, the Castle of Mey. Stirling Castle is a fortress with a colourful history, while the capital of Edinburgh has a wealth of other sights to explore.

Take a trip to Hadrian's Wall or the Holy Island of Lindisfarne, followed by York, a cathedral city with an internationally renowned Viking past.

otherInfo.text: Guest speaker: John Hughes, judge for the Royal Horticultural Society.

inclusions: Accommodation on board the stylish and intimate Aegean Odyssey
All meals on board the ship, and wine with dinner
Guided shore excursions in superb ports of call
On-board gratuities for restaurant and cabin staff
An informative lecture programme featuring guest speakers
All transfers between airports, hotels and the ship when abroad

stops.title: Day 1 - London, England, United Kingdom
stops.text: Embark Aegean Odyssey at Tower Bridge, London.

stops.title: Day 3 - Guernsey, Channel Islands, United Kingdom
stops.text: Highlights include the Hauteville House, home of Victor Hugo, the Candie Gardens and Castle Cornet and the 13th-century fortress.

stops.title: Day 4 - Falmouth, England, United Kingdom
stops.text: Visit the Eden Project in Falmouth, or take a tour to St Michael's Mount.

stops.title: Day 5 - Tresco, Isles of Scilly, United Kingdom
stops.text: Spend the morning at Abbey Gardens in Tresco.

stops.title: Day 6 - Holyhead, Wales, United Kingdom
stops.text: Choice of excursions: Visit Anglesey's coastline or Caenarfon Castle.

stops.title: Day 7 - Dublin, Ireland
stops.text: Take in all the great sites including Malahide Castle and Abbey Tavern or visit some of the finest scenery in Ireland - Country Wicklow.

stops.title: Day 8 - Oban, Scotland, United Kingdom
stops.text: Visit Oban and discover one of Scotland's finest stately homes, Inveraray Castle.

stops.title: Day 9 - Portree, Scotland, United Kingdom
stops.text: Step ashore for a half day sightseeting tour in Portree. Visit the fascinating Skye Museum, Dunvegan Castle or the colourful harbour of Portree.

stops.title: Day 10 - Scrabster, Scotland, United Kingdom
stops.text: Visit the most northerly castle on the British mainland, Castle of Mey. Learn more about the highland clearances or stop at the small coastal village of John o Groats.

stops.title: Day 11 - Rosyth, Scotland, United Kingdom
stops.text: Admire Scotland's capital, with a tour of The Royal Mile or visit Stirling Castle.

stops.title: Day 12 - Tyne, England, United Kingdom
stops.text: Explore the remains of the Roman Empire, Hadrian's Wall or discover Holy Island.

stops.title: Day 13 - Hull, England, United Kingdom
stops.text: Spend the day in the old Vikings town of York.

stops.title: Day 15 - London (Tilbury), England, United Kingdom
stops.text: Disembark Aegean Odyssey in Tilbury near London.
